content: the elise boutique boho corner hammock design by wendy keith these hammocks are such a great addition to any room adding a little boho flair to your corners this pattern contains instructions for 3 different sizes and they can be customized to your own liking i hope you enjoy this simple pattern and have fun while making your own pattern level beginner/intermediate materials -peaches and crème recommended or any type of cotton yarn -j/6mm hook -plastic wall hooks or any hooks of your choosing abbreviations chain-chain double_crochet-double_crochet lp-loop slip_stitch-slip_stitch this pattern is worked in row the chain 3 at the beginning of each row does not count as a double_crochet but is part of the first loop of that row that you will be working on throughout the pattern the pattern is also written using u s terminology please read the pattern in it s entirety first let s get started row 1 chain 4 slip_stitch in the 4th chain from hook turn 1 loop row 2 chain 3 double_crochet in the lp chain 1 double_crochet in the same lp turn 2 loops row 3 chain 3 double_crochet in the 1st lp chain 1 double_crochet in the same lp chain 1 double_crochet in the next lp turn 3 loops row 4 chain 3 double_crochet in the 1st lp chain 1 double_crochet in the same lp chain 1 double_crochet in the next lp and chain 1 double_crochet in the last lp turn 4 loops continue this sequence until you reach the desired length these are the amount of row i do for my hammocks small hammock 33 row medium hammock 50 row large hammock 65 row if you d like more drape in the middle of your hammock add an extra double_crochet chain 1 in the middle of the row starting about row 20 when you get the desired drape just stop adding the extra double_crochet chain 1 this is not a must for the pattern only if you want additional drap in your hammock once you reach the size of hammock you re making it is time to add the border and fringe this will be the same for all sizes the first number is for the small hammock second number is for the medium hammock and the last number is for the large hammock row 34 51 66 chain 2 2 double_crochet in the first lp 2 double_crochet in each of the next lps all the way to the end of the row turn row 35-37 52-54 67-69 chain 2 double_crochet in each stitch to the end of the row turn fasten_off and weave in ends you can leave your hammock as is or add fringe to add frige cut yarn about 12 to 15 inches long i use 4 strands per tassel fold in half and pull through the last row of the hammock the loop the 4 strands of the loose ends to make your knot pull tight you can add to every other double_crochet to have
